Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class Check

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.Check
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntCheck, ObjectCheck
    public abstract class Check
extends Object

    Methods for checking preconditions. If you want to check a single precondition for an argument, you can use the static methods. If you need to check multiple preconditions for a single argument, you might prefer to use the instance methods instead. For example: 

     int i = Check.that(numChairs, "numChairs")
     .gte(2)
     .lte(10)
     .test(numChairs % 2 == 0, "numChairs%2==0")
     .value();

    To facilitate concise coding, some methods take just the argument to be tested and the name of the argument, not a complete error message. For example: 

     Check.notNull(name, "name"); // -> resulting error message: "name must not null"

    If you want to provide a custom message, choose the overloaded method that takes message arguments: 

     Check.notNull(name, "Please specify a name", null); // -> "Please specify a name"
 Check.notNull(name, "Please specify a name", new Object[0]); // -> "Please specify a name"
 Check.notNull(name, "Please specify a name", ""); // -> "Please specify a name"
 Check.notNull(name, "Please specify a %s", "toy"); // -> "Please specify a toy"

    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

      • that

        public static <T extends Exception> void that​(boolean condition,
                                              Supplier<T> exceptionSupplier)
                                       throws T extends Exception
        Generic check method. Can also be used for other purposes than checking preconditions. Throws the exception supplied by the provided supplier if the provided condition evaluates to false, else does nothing.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of exception thrown if the condition fails
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition to evaluate
        exceptionSupplier - The exception supplier
        Throws:
        T - The exception thrown if the condition fails
        T extends Exception

                                                   Supplier<T> exceptionSupplier)
                                            throws T extends Exception
        Generic check method. Throws the exception supplied by the provided exception supplier if the provided condition evaluates to false, else returns result.

        T - The type of exception thrown if the condition fails
        U - The type of object returned if the condition is met
        Parameters:

        result - The object returned if the condition is met
        exceptionSupplier - The exception supplier
        Returns:
        The object supplied by the resultSupplier
        Throws:

        T extends Exception

      • index

        public static int index​(int arg,
                        int maxExclusive,
                        String argName)
                 throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if arg is less than zero or greater than or equal to maxExclusive, else returns arg. This is especially useful to test "from" arguments, which generally should be less than length or size of the object operated upon (maxExclusive would then be that length or size).
        Parameters:
        arg - The argument to be tested The argument to test
        maxExclusive - The maximum allowed value (exclusive)
        Returns:
        The argument
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • index

        public static int index​(int arg,
                        int min,
                        int max,
                        String argName)
                 throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if arg is less than min or greater than max, else returns arg. This is especially useful to test "to" or "until" arguments, which generally should be greater than or equal to the "from" argument, and less than or equal to to the length or size of the object operated upon.
        Parameters:
        arg - The argument to be tested The argument to test
        min - The minimum allowed value (inclusive)
        max - The maximum allowed value (inclusive)
        Returns:
        The argument
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • state

        public static void state​(boolean condition,
                         String message,
                         Object... msgArgs)
                  throws IllegalStateException
        Does nothing if the provided condition evaluates to true, else throws an IllegalStateException with the provided message and message arguments. msgArg is allowed to be null, in which case it is ignored as a message argument.
        Parameters:
        condition -
        message - The exception message
        msgArgs - The String.format message arguments (may be null or empty)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the condition evaluates to false

        This Check object

      • inRange

        public Check inRange​(int minInclusive,
                     int maxInclusive)
        See inRange.
        Returns:
        This Check object

      • value

        public <U> U value()
        Returns the argument being tested. To be used as the last call after a chain of checks. For example: 
         Integer i = Check.that(counter, "counter").notNull().value();
        Type Parameters:
        U -
        Returns:
        The argument

      • intValue

        public int intValue()
        Returns the argument being tested as an int. If the argument being tested actually is an int rather than an Integer, this method saves the cost of unboxing incurred by value(). If the argument neither is int nor an Integer this method throws a ClassCastException.
        Returns:
        The argument cast or converted to an int
